members.name: suspendPolicy
members.comment: Returns the policy used to suspend threads in the target VM for this event set. This policy is selected from the suspend policies for each event's request; the target VM chooses the policy which suspends the most threads. The target VM suspends threads according to that policy and that policy is returned here. See EventRequest for the possible policy values. In rare cases, the suspend policy may differ from the requested value if a ClassPrepareEvent has occurred in a debugger system thread. See ClassPrepareEvent.thread() for details.

return: the suspendPolicy which is either SUSPEND_ALL, SUSPEND_EVENT_THREAD or SUSPEND_NONE.

members.name: eventIterator
members.comment: Return an iterator specific to Event objects.

members.name: resume
members.comment: Resumes threads suspended by this event set. If the suspendPolicy() is EventRequest.SUSPEND_ALL, a call to this method is equivalent to VirtualMachine.resume(). If the suspend policy is EventRequest.SUSPEND_EVENT_THREAD, a call to this method is equivalent to ThreadReference.resume() for the event thread. Otherwise, a call to this method is a no-op.
